member.summary: Indicates whether the parameter key ends with '*' (and is probably URL encoded).
member.returns: true if the parameter key ends with '*', otherwise false. The return value dependens on the state of .

remarks.para: A trailing '*' in the Key indicates that charset and/or language might be present (RFC 2231) and the value is URL encoded. If the value is in Double-Quotes, no trailing '*' in the Key is allowed.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.Intls.Parameters.Encodings.HttpQuotedString
member.summary: Encodes and decodes quoted HTTP quoted strings

remarks.para: The algorithm is described at

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.Intls.Parameters.Serializers.EncodingActionAnalyzer.IsMaskChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Indicates whether has to be masked with a backslash.
member.param: The to exmine.
member.returns: true if has to be masked because it is a double quote or a backslash.

remarks.para: In the RFCs is nothing said about what should happen if a '\"' appears inside of a parameter value.
The suggestions came from https://mimesniff.spec.whatwg.org/#parsing-a-mime-type ยง 4.5.:

list.item: 4.1. Precede each occurrence of U+0022 (") or U+005C (\) in value with U+005C (\).

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.Intls.TokenValidator
member.summary: Validates tokens.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.Intls.TokenValidator.ValidateTokenParameter(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests whether a method parameter represents a valid token.
member.param: The string to test.
The parameter's name.
If true, three aditional characters ('*', '\'', '%') are treated as invalid since RFC 2231 doesn't allow these characters in parameter keys.
member.remarks: Throws if is an empty string or consists only of white space. Leading and trailing white space around a valid token is accepted.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.Intls.TokenValidator.IsToken(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests whether is a valid token.
member.param: The span to test.
If true, three aditional characters ('*', '\'', '%') are treated as invalid since RFC 2231 doesn't allow these characters in parameter keys.
member.returns: true if is a valid token, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Returns false even when is empty or consists only of white space. Leading and trailing white space around a valid token is accepted.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeCache
member.summary: A memory cache that's used to retrieve often used file type extensions or MIME types faster.

remarks.para: It's an expensive operation to parse the resources for MIME types and file type extensions. To overcome this issue, a small cache is is hold in memory to retrieve the most frequently used MIME types and file type extensions faster.

The cache is pre-populated with some of the most frequently used file type extensions and MIME types but it "learns" with every query and stores after some time only the data it is recently asked for. The cache doesn't exceed a given . The default value for this is , but you can enlarge the with if your application uses more than 16 different file types.
There is no way to reduce the , but you can the whole cache. After that, the next time is asked for data, it creates a new cache with the or a larger one, if you have called before.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeCache.DefaultFileTypeExtension
member.summary: The file type extension that is used as a fallback value.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeCache.DefaultCapacity
member.summary: The default capacity of the cache.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeCache.Capacity
member.summary: Gets the current capacity of the cache.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enlarges the of the cache to the specified value.
member.param: The new value for . If is smaller than the current value of , nothing changes.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeCache.Clear
member.summary: Clears the cache.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeFormats
member.summary: Named constants to specify options to format objects as . The flags can be combined.

example.para: Format a instance into a standards-compliant string using several options:

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeFormats.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default format (including the , without line wrapping, and with one SPACE character (U+0020) before each parameter).

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeFormats.IgnoreParameters
member.summary: Specifies that the are not included in the output and any other option is ignored.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeFormats.AvoidSpace
member.summary: Specifies that white space before a parameter is omitted.

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeFormats.Url
member.summary: Specifies that the output is formatted for the use within a URI. This option is combined with .

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeFormats.LineWrapping
member.summary: Specifies that long parameters will be wrapped according to RFC 2231 if its length exceeds a given maximum. This option is ignored if any of the flags or is set.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeString
member.summary: Static class that works on s and offers methods that perform conversions between Internet Media Type strings ("MIME types") and file names.

example.para: Convert a file name into an Internet Media Type and get a file type extension from an Internet Media Type:

member.name: F:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeString.OctetStream
member.summary: The default Internet Media Type ("MIME type").

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeString.ToFileTypeExtension(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts an Internet Media Type to an appropriate file type extension.
member.param: A that represents an Internet Media Type ("MIME type") or null.
true specifies, that the period "." (U+002E) is included in the retrieved file type extension, false, that it's not.
member.returns: An appropriate file type extension for .

remarks.para: If no other file type extension can be found, is returned. specifies whether the period is included.

This method doesn't perform any validation on . If a strong validation of the input is needed, the instance methods MimeTypeInfo.GetFileTypeExtension(bool) and MimeType.GetFileTypeExtension(bool) are better suited.

Internally a small memory cache is used to retrieve often used file type extensions faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.

example.para: Convert a file name into an Internet Media Type and get a file type extension from an Internet Media Type:

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeString.ToFileTypeExtension(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts an Internet Media Type to an appropriate file type extension.
member.param: A read-only character span that represents an Internet Media Type ("MIME type").
true specifies, that the period "." (U+002E) is included in the retrieved file type extension, false, that it's not.
member.returns: An appropriate file type extension for .

remarks.para: If no other file type extension can be found, is returned. specifies whether the period is included.

This method doesn't perform any validation on . If a strong validation of the input is needed, the instance methods MimeTypeInfo.GetFileTypeExtension(bool) and MimeType.GetFileTypeExtension(bool) are better suited.

Internally a small memory cache is used to retrieve often used file type extensions faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.

example.para: Convert a file name into an Internet Media Type and get a file type extension from an Internet Media Type:

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeString.FromFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a file name into an Internet Media Type ("MIME type").
member.param: A file path, file name, file type extension (no matter whether with or without the period "."), or null.
member.returns: An appropriate Internet Media Type ("MIME type") for .

remarks.para: If no other Internet Media Type could be found, is returned.

Internally a small memory cache is used to retrieve often used Internet Media Types faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.

example.para: Convert a file name into an Internet Media Type and get a file type extension from an Internet Media Type:

Internally a small memory cache is used to retrieve often used Internet Media Types faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeTypeInfo
member.summary: Provides the information stored in an Internet Media Type ("MIME type").

note.para: is a quite large structure. Pass it to other methods by reference (in, ref or out parameters in C#)!

If you intend to hold a for a long time in memory and if this is parsed from a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that comes from a very long , keep in mind, that the holds a reference to that . Consider in this case to make a copy of the structure with : The copy is built on a separate that is case-normalized and only as long as needed.

example.para: Efficient parsing of an Internet Media Type :

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeTypeInfo.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.remarks:
If you intend to hold a for a long time in memory and if this is parsed from a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that comes from a very long , keep in mind, that the holds a reference to that . Consider in this case to make a copy of the structure: The copy is built on a separate that is case-normalized and only as long as needed.
Use the instance method , if you can, to avoid the costs of boxing.

member.summary: Provides the information stored in an Internet Media Type Parameter-.

note.para: is a quite large structure. Pass it to other methods by reference (in, ref or out parameters in C#)!

If you intend to hold a for a long time in memory and if this is parsed from a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that comes from a very long , keep in mind, that the holds a reference to that . Consider in this case to make a copy of the structure with : The copy is built on a separate that is case-normalized and only as long as needed.

example.para: Efficient parsing of an Internet Media Type :

If you intend to hold a for a long time in memory and if this is parsed from a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that comes from a very long , keep in mind, that the holds a reference to that . member.summary: Tries to parse a read-only character memory as .
member.param: true indicates that the should be examinated and sanitized.
The ReadOnlyMemory<char> to be parsed.
When the method returns true the parameter holds the parsed .

After the method has returned, the argument value indicates whether the MIME type parameter's key have had a trailing '*' character that indicates that language and charset has been present and URL-encoding has been used. This information is important because the trailing '*' is eaten by the method.
member.returns: true if could be parsed as .

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeType.GetFileTypeExtension(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an appropriate file type extension.
member.param: true specifies, that the period "." (U+002E) is included in the retrieved file type extension, false, that it's not.
member.returns: An appropriate file type extension.

remarks.para: If no other file type extension can be found, is returned. specifies whether the period is included.

Internally a small memory cache is used to retrieve often used file type extensions faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeType.FromFileName(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Creates an appropriate instance for a given file name.
member.param: A file path, file name, file type extension (no matter whether with or without the period "."), or null.
member.returns: An appropriate instance for .
member.remarks: Internally a small memory cache is used to find often used file type extensions faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.MimeTypes.MimeType.FromFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an appropriate instance for a given file name.
member.param: A file path, file name, file type extension (no matter whether with or without the period "."), or null.

member.remarks: Internally a small memory cache is used to find often used file type extensions faster. You can enlarge the size of this cache with MimeCache.EnlargeCapacity(int) or you can delete it with MimeCache.Clear() if your application does not need it anymore.
